20110102142006.000|20110102142007.000|CC1|HE NEVER SOLD IT.               
20110102142007.000|20110102142008.000|CC1|HE CARRIED IT WITH HIM

20110102143706.000|20110102143706.000|CC1|  you have unusual changes in   
20110102143706.000|20110102143709.000|CC1|behavior or thoughts of suicide.
20110102143709.000|20110102143709.000|CC1|  Antidepressants can increase  
20110102143709.000|20110102143709.000|CC1| these in children, teens, and  
20110102143709.000|20110102143712.000|CC1|         young adults.          
20110102143712.000|20110102143712.000|CC1|  Cymbalta is not approved for  
20110102143712.000|20110102143715.000|CC1|       children under 18.       
20110102143715.000|20110102143715.000|CC1|     People taking MAOIs or     
20110102143715.000|20110102143717.000|CC1|          thioridazine          
20110102143717.000|20110102143717.000|CC1| or with uncontrolled glaucoma  
20110102143717.000|20110102143720.000|CC1|   should not take Cymbalta.    
20110102143720.000|20110102143720.000|CC1|   Taking it with NSAID pain    
20110102143720.000|20110102143721.000|CC1|           relievers,           
20110102143721.000|20110102143721.000|CC1| aspirin, or blood thinners may

20110102143724.000|20110102143724.000|CC1|  Severe liver problems, some   
20110102143724.000|20110102143726.000|CC1|     fatal, were reported.      
20110102143726.000|20110102143726.000|CC1|Signs include abdominal pain and
20110102143726.000|20110102143729.000|CC1| yellowing of the skin or eyes. 
20110102143729.000|20110102143729.000|CC1|Talk with your doctor about your
20110102143729.000|20110102143731.000|CC1|           medicines,

20110102143731.000|20110102143734.000|CC1|    if you have high fever,

20110102143736.000|20110102143736.000|CC1|     to address a possible

20110102143738.000|20110102143740.000|CC1|      use, liver disease,
